# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    line_length = 0
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        result *= word * " "
        line_length += length(word) + 1
    end
    return strip(result)
end

# Example usage
text = "This is an example of text wrapping."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

This function `wrap_string` takes a string `text` and an optional maximum 'text_width' parameter to control line length. It iterates over each word in `text`, adding words to the result string and inserting a newline character whenever adding another word would exceed the specified `text_width`. After finishing, it returns the wrapped text, ensuring no line is longer than `text_width`.
